content.content: Maker Relay 27  Hey everyone, thanks for checking out Maker Relay! Whether you hold Maker (MKR) or DAI, own a vault, or want to get more involved in MakerDAO governance, this is your one-stop-shop for updates on the MakerDAO ecosystem.  Votes Check our Participation Tools page for links to system stats, Dai stability, collateral & liquidation metrics, protocol analytics, auctions, and governance history.  This Week in Governance Polls Some polls use instant run-off voting, so you can select multiple options, and ranked-choices will be prioritized. The week’s Governance Polls will close on Jan 14 at 16:00 UTC.     Poll Name Vote Discussion Type     Rates Proposal Vote Discussion Rates   Whitelist Gnosis Vote  BTC/USD OSM (MIP10c9-SP16), LINK/USD OSM (MIP10c9-SP17), ZRX/USD OSM (MIP10c9-SP18), YFI/USD OSM (MIP10c9-SP19), COMP/USD OSM (MIP10c9-SP20)  Oracles   Whitelist Set Protocol Vote  AAVE/USD Medianzer (MIP10c9-SP21), LRC/USD Medianzer (MIP10c9-SP22), YFI/USD Medianzer (MIP10c9-SP23), ZRX/USD Medianzer (MIP10c9-SP24), UNI/USD Medianzer (MIP10c9-SP25)  Oracles   Add UNI-V2-WBTC-ETH as Collateral Type Vote  Application, Risk Evaluation, Smart Contracts Evaluation, Oracles Evaluation  Onboarding   Investigate Implementation of a WBTC-B Vault-Type with a lower LR Vote Discussion Signal Request   Adjust the System Surplus Buffer Vote Discussion System Parameter   Adjust FLAP Auction parameters Vote Discussion Auction Parameter     MIP Inclusion Polls The Inclusion Polls will close on Jan 14 at 16:00 UTC.     MIP Poll MIP Info/Further Discussion     MIP29: Peg Stability Module Vote Discussion   MIP30: CropJoin - Farmable cUSDC Adaptor Vote Discussion   MIP7c3-SP5: Onboarding Sébastien Derivaux to the Risk Domain Vote Discussion   MIP7c3-SP6: Onboarding Sam MacPherson to the Smart Contracts Domain Vote Discussion   MIP13c3-SP7: Governance Communications Domain Vote Discussion   MIP13c3-SP8: Maker Protocol Cover with Nexus Mutual Vote Discussion   MIP28c7-SP2: Onboarding JuanJuan to the Operational Support Domain Vote Discussion    Check out an ‘at-a-glance’ view of the current Vault types and their parameters on MakerBurn  Last Week The USDC PSM was activated on Dec 28, 2020 @ 14:01 UTC  The PSM-USDC-A vault type added using USDC as collateral The global line parameter increased by 3M due to the debt ceiling changes  The ETH-A, USDC-A, PSM-USDC-A Debt Ceilings executive vote was executed on Jan 7, 2021, @ 07:36 UTC  ETH-A Debt Ceiling has increased from 590M to 740M USDC-A Debt Ceiling has increased from 485M to 555M PSM-USDC-A Debt Ceiling has increased from 3M to 30M Global Debt Ceiling has increased by 247M   Signal Requests  Rolling out the Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module (DC-IAM) Interim DAO Operating Budget Increasing Dust Parameter Adjust ETH-A Debt Ceiling (2021-02)   Updates  MIPs Weekly MIPS Update #23 (Jan 4-8) Proposals in the Request-For-Comments phase include:   MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign  Defines DssGov, a contract replacement for DSChief that comes with improved security, usability, and functionality for holders of the Maker governance token (MKR)    MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  A technical proposal for an active reserve based on the Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  Provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cdai. It also converts USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module  Provides a smart contract implementation of a Streaming Payments System for Maker    Sub-proposals in the Request-For-Comments phase include:  MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol (Declaration of Intent)  Learn more about Maker Improvement Proposals (MIPs)  Smart Contracts  MIP21 going into Kovan this week, executive this Friday. Team will focus on MIP 14, MIP 25, MIP 30 next. End of 2020 was pretty aggressive and we lost some smart contract engineers.  We’ll need to pace ourselves and train up more people to have 4 collateral types a month, 1 MIP, and a set of community initiatives.   Sam is working on the UI for PSM.  Quantstamp audit report for PSM released Sam’s PSM update, citing the audit The governance and risk call highlighted a list of outstanding tasks for making the PSM robust:  Documentation The UI Moving/scuttling the old collateral types Liquidating the old collateral types into the PSM       Risk   FLAP (Surplus Auction) parameter adjustments, 11th Jan 2021  Urgent notice calling for expedited on-chain poll for a parameter change.   Analysts finished collateral evaluation for tBTC  The conclusion recommends a re-evaluation at a later point after the project has had some time to live and liquidity picks up.   cUSDC CropJoin risk evaluation in the works. Monet_Supply posted a signal request for increasing Dust Parameter. Andy is working on refreshing Maker portfolio Value at Risk model(VaR):  Helping define surplus buffer and risk mitigation during the bull run.   New report from rate setting working group is out. RWA progress on due diligence, the team needs a lawyer since that expertise isn’t there…yet.   Oracles  LP tokens are the focus for collateral onboarding going forward. We need a formal audit before we start raising ceilings on LP tokens. 10 whitelisting proposals will go up this week.  17 in the backlog!   Began work on the RWA oracle last week.   State of the Peg  Peg778×203 7.78 KB   DAI peg looking stable with a few spikes within a frothy market.   VWAP1845×574 47.7 KB   Volume at around $1.6 billion, with a , this last week. Average VWAP (Volume-Weighted-Average-Price) places Dai at $1.001   Dai Supply911×803 97.1 KB   Crawling closer to 1.5 billion in Dai outstanding, with ETH outpacing all the other collaterals. The PSM filled up pretty quickly which is a good sign.  ETH-A 627,167,751   USDC-A 438,341,301 WBTC 124,410,149 TUSD 51,282,155 ETH-B 45,152,416 PSM-USDC 27,693,436 PAX 19,442,809 LINK 9,933,753 YFI 5,642,302 UNI 4,007,879 UniV2DaiEth 2,999,593 BAT 2,845,414 LRC 807,586 BAL 337,198 MANA 298,341 ZRX 239,938 renBTC 185,407 KNC 111,120 GUSD 52,551 AAVE 24,371 COMP 18,158 USDT 1,096 USDC-B 347      ETH vaults largest collateralization bucket is at 390%. After the past 24 hours, it makes sense to have vaults well protected.    Liquidation walls at $787 ETH.    ETH-B has a large collateralization bucket at 130%.   1231×68 9.22 KB   But it’s dominated by one large vault.   870×71 9.91 KB   304K Dai out for liquidation; most auctions seem to be functioning well.    The largest pools outside of Compound, Curve.fi, and uniswap account for 45% of protocol-locked-Dai.  Dai Stats | http://dai.descipher.io/ | makerburn.com  Community  Maker Forum Deep Dai-ve   Stay Grounded Maker Community. Stay Grounded  @ElProgreso addressing the rise of MKR and ETH, and why it means we need to stay focused, more than ever.    What happens if DAI loses it’s peg and goes to $2 for example?  @BlueCat began a discussion about ‘what-ifs’ and questions the results.    [Poll] What is the mission/vision of MakerDAO?  @SebVentures making a post to begin discussion (and a poll) in an attempt to determine the mission/vision for moving forward as a community.     Articles   Explica: What is Dai and Why is this Cryptocurrency Presented as an Alternative to Obtain Dollars?  Breaking down Dai and its advantages/disadvantages for use with different purposes.    American Banker: How decentralized finance could reshape banking  A journalistic take on what the future of DeFi could mean for ‘traditional banking’ and the trends in financial industries, the world over.    The Block: A guide to The Block’s data dashboard  “This article is an overview of the charts included on the [Block’s] dashboards, why those charts have been chosen, and what can be learned by following them — as well as pointing out interesting recent trends.”    CryptoSlate: Maker (MKR) rips 80% higher over the past week after extended bear market against Ethereum  Discussing the increase in MKR token value, as well as touching on the ‘need for decentralized stablecoins.’     Tweet of the Week   twitter.com    Grogu @eip1559  MakerDAO is the first best and longest existing example of a DAO(decentralized autonomous organization).  As it grows and more $mkr holders get educated and incentivized to participate in governance the more decentralized it will get.    Key is distribution with education 💡   9:43 PM - 7 Jan 2021           7             Meetings and Events  MakerDAO Open Calls  Community Call  Tuesdays 9AM PST | 10AM MST | 12PM EST | 5PM UTC |  6PM CET | Crowdcast    Community Collateral Onboarding  Wednesdays at 18:00 UTC | Zoom - Message #governance-and-risk for Admission   Introduction | Collateral Status Index  Next week’s call is January 13 at 1 EST | 18 UTC with xDAI [Stake]      Governance & Risk  Thursdays at 16:00 UTC | Zoom  Message #governance-and-risk for Admission  Agenda | Dial-in call link | Calendar   Archives | Contributing      Community Events  Jan 15: A Deep Dive into Prediction Markets    Hackathons  Jan 15-Feb 7, 2021: MARKETMAKE Build the future of finance.    Reference Links Discuss and debate Maker governance in the Forum and over Maker Chat Propose technical changes, poll, and vote in the Governance Portal Learn more about the Maker protocol in our Documentation Check our Governance Tools Resource for links to system status, Dai stability, and collateral/liquidations, protocol analytics, auctions, and some of the history of governance.  Have Feedback? We value your input! Please reply to this post, take our survey or join us in the Community-Development channel to let us know what you want to see. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does and should not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is purely for informative and for communications purposes only.

If you’re interested in checking out an audio version please check us out on Youtube:      Anchor.fm:    Anchor    Voices of MKR Relay Ep. 27 by Voices of MakerDAO • A podcast on Anchor Forum: https://forum.makerdao.com Rocket.Chat: https://chat.makerdao.com Voting Portal: https://Vote.MakerDAO.com Maker Relay (written version): https://forum.makerdao.com/t/maker-relay-ep-27-happy-2021/6016 Learn more about the Maker protocol:...
